title: Rotational KE - rank total KE - 3 objects sliding

content.question: Object Name Radius Rotational Inertia Translational Speed Angular Speed Hoop <math alttext="r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="I sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> Disk <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> <math alttext="r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="one half I sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> Disk <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> <math alttext="one half r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="one eighth I sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="2 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> A circular hoop and two solid disks are placed on a horizontal surface where they can move with negligible friction. The hoop and disks are set into motion such that each moves forward and rotates about its center of mass, as shown in the Top View figure. The hoop and disks have the same mass and angular speeds. The radii, rotational inertia, and translational speeds of the hoop and disks are listed in the table. Which of the following correctly compares the total kinetic energies <math alttext="K sub hoop" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>hoop</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="K sub Disk 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>, and <math alttext="K sub Disk 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> of the hoop, Disk <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, and Disk <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub Disk 2 is greater than K sub Disk 1, which equals K sub hoop" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>hoop</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub Disk 2 is greater than K sub hoop, which is greater than K sub Disk 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>hoop</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub hoop is greater than K sub Disk 1, which is greater than K sub Disk 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>hoop</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub hoop is greater than K sub Disk 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>hoop</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>, but it cannot be determined how <math alttext="K sub Disk 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> compares without more information about <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub hoop is greater than K sub Disk 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>hoop</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>, but it cannot be determined how <math alttext="K sub Disk 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mtext>Disk</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> compares without more information about <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
